name: Nativo Lodge Albuquerque

reviews.text: We chose this hotel because it was described as "cultrally distinctive." The lobby had museum quality items that were beautiful to behold. It was so inviting that we all chose to use it as our hang out spot. We used the indoor/outdoor pool daily, as well as the hot tub. One night we had an outdoor picnic on the tables by their outdoor teepee. The staff was responsive and the location was close to the freeway and yet quiet enough to be enjoyable. We were able to see some of the balloon fiesta activity right from the window of the fourth floor! I would return to this place again. The only setback was that they charged to use the internet services.
reviews.title: A culturally distinctive hotel that creates unique memories

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wife and I (from MD) stayed for 4 nights at the Nativo (during the 40th anniversary of the Baloon Fiesta celebration. We had great weather at a very hospitable hotel. The Nativo is centrally located - convenient to Route 25 going to Santa Fe or the baloon fiesta activities. Numerous food venues; Old Town Plaza; downtown sites; and the U of NM all are quickly accessable with a car from the hotel. Reception staff was cordial, respectful, considerate, helpful and knowledgeable (a great plus). The hotel has great "curb appeal" and had a larger "footprint" than the photos indicated. Housekeeping staff was on the one.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: Having praised The Nativo, it was not w/out a few (MINOR) shortcomings:
reviews.title: A unique Native American experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Our room took some getting use to b/c of the insufficient lighting (along w/ the table lamp being loosely connected (not broken mind-u).
reviews.title: Pretty nice, decent location.

reviews.text: 2. The bed mattress wasn't firm but a bit overly cushiony & spongy.
reviews.title: It does the job.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here because it was the closest hotel to the Sandia Casino that took dogs (we went to see a Tedeschi Trucks concert there). We ended up leaving Rio at home, but were pleasantly surprised at how cool the hotel was! We had a large "junior suite" for $95 that had an extremely comfortable king bed, one of the best beds I've had in a hotel in recent memory. Big windows with views of the mountains, big TV, fridge...and outside, there are cultural decorations - even a teepee with chairs and music outside near the (small) pool. The pool is nice because part of it is shaded by a roof for when that scorching summer sun is too much. The staff was very friendly, and there's a great 24-hour Mexican restaurant called Taco Cabana across the street. There's a free shuttle to the casino. There was even a goofy (and free) concert by Sanjaya from American Idol on Saturday night. The weakest link is the room service, but at least it is extremely inexpensive ($22 for breakfast for two??). We could hear the whiny kids in the room next to us, but one way or another, we will definitely stay here any time we're in Albuquerque!
reviews.title: Unique atmosphere - and extremely comfortable bed

reviews.text: The second time we've stayed at the Nativo Lodge. The check-in clerks are friendly and accommodating to your needs. The rooms are large, comfortable and clean. We love the lobby and decor of the property. The indoor/outdoor pool is a great feature, kids love it!! A tee pee outside the pool is an added bonus for kids! Breakfast is included and was delicious.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: This was such a great place. We loved the decor, the vibe, the serenity of it all.
reviews.title: Peaceful, Serene, Loved it all! Didn't wanna leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We weren't there on a saturday as previous posters mentioned, so it was very quiet, calm and nice. There was some sort of conference but didn't see or hear them.
reviews.title: We hated it and will never stay there again!

reviews.text: Great beds, AVEDA toiletries (my fave!!) starbucks coffee in the room (another fave! :) and dining room, where we really enjoyed the breakfast buffet. It included new mexico red chili. The indoor / outdoor pool was busy but we still enjoyed it. The tipi (teepee?) next to the outdoor pool is super cool! Loved all of it and wished we could have stayed much longer.
reviews.title: It was Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quick overnight stay (before return flight) booked on Priceline. Front desk was helpful, particularly sending us over to the historic district, about 15 min. away. Everything from t-shirts to portraits. The best thing about the hotel was its lobby. Nice, large and comfortable leather seating in a Native American ambiance. The rooms match the decor and are also large and comfortable, if a little dated. The location was convenient; overall a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Pleasant Ambiance

reviews.text: Room 321 had two double beds; mattresses were saggy, overly soft and needed replacing. Problem was compounded by worn-out mattress pad, ill-fitting sheets, and blankets that were too small for one bed--the lumpiest hotel bed I have every slept in! After not sleeping much the first night, called in the morning to get better bedding. Took an hour for housekeeping to arrive, nearly two hours before replacement bedding arrived and things were satisfactorily resolved. The next night was better, however the staff did not extend themselves at all; we had to complain loudly to get any response. Also we ended up having to pay for the "complimentary" breakfast; an hour before breakfast was over they were already out of both orange juice and coffee. No one offered to provide more.
reviews.title: Bad beds, indifferent service

reviews.text: Unique decor and rooms OK. Booked after reviewing their website that listed, among other amenities, "Complimentary buffet breakfast" under Hotel Features and was bummed out when informed in the morning that if we wanted the buffet it would cost $8.95+ tax — bait and switch? or bad management of website? Had read about the Saturday night disco noise but called in advance and were given a room looking out at the mountains — no problem with music from the party, only loud people in the parking area, probably taking a smoke outside of the bar area. Beds ended up being a bit lumpy after a while from ill-fitting sheets, blanket and old mattress protector crumpling up in the middle of a soft mattress; some people will like the very heavy comforter, we did not. Otherwise, room was clean, but nothing as special as I had hoped for from the website description.
reviews.title: OK — website needs updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice property conveniently located and favorably priced. Our rooms were clean (we stayed twice) and adequately furnished. The staff are very friendly and try hard to please but in some instances a little additional training might be helpful. Food service in the hotel did not work for us, but in Albuquerque dining options are almost unlimited. While there we went on a Jeep tour on Diamond Tail ranch (NMJeeptours.com) which was excellent and we have reviewed separately. We would happily return to this property and would take another ranch tour.
reviews.title: Good place to stay
Hidden gem, all good
reviews.text: Very upscale at a low price, good rooms, good lobby, great location
My husband & I stayed here for 6 nights, ( Oct 13-19) along with other family members (total of 8).
reviews.title: Tranquil atmosphere

reviews.text: We loved the tranquil atmosphere of the hotel, relaxing, quiet. The indoor/outdoor pool was great, most days we were the only ones in it. The weather was awesome 70-80's.
reviews.title: Would not recommend

reviews.text: Breakfast was included in our deal, it was filling, I agree that service was a bit on the slower side, however we were on vacation and went with the flow. Not opened for lunch either.
reviews.title: Have been back 3 years in a row

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing we were disappointed in is that the bar is not opened till 5pm, so no food or drinks during the day, and we understand during the week, but weekends especially Sunday during football season. The front desk did put the football game on for us however we had to go out to get our food and drinks.
reviews.title: Very Nice themed hotel, with hospitable front desk clerk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went out to see the sunset on Sandia Peak Tram returned about 8:50pm on sunday nite, went to the bar, we were the only ones there, The bartender, Dave was AWESOME he was about to close since they had no customers but he stayed open for us gave us Dave made us fresh margarita's YUMMY! actually ran out of limes LOL
reviews.title: Hospitable and Cozy

description: Travelers from all over the world stay at the Nativo Lodge to experience Native American culture through the hotel’s vibrant art, innovative technology, and cultural aspects. No other hotel achieves the unique blend of contemporary and traditional Native American atmosphere within their luxurious rooms. Conveniently located near Balloon Fiesta Park and major attractions in Albuquerque, guests can enjoy breathtaking views of the Sandia Mountains and the New Mexico landscape, and Santa Fe is just a quick 45 minutes away. Spacious rooms with private balconies, free WIFI, daily Happy Hour, and true hospitality and charm of Native American contemporary culture make staying at the Nativo Lodge a one-of-a-kind experience."Hotels supporting cultural causes."
